author: mklement0
body:
See also: #12625

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
Push-Location (New-Directory temp:/$PID).FullName
# Look for commands of type Application only in the current folder.
Get-Command ./* -CommandType Application | Should -BeNullOrEmpty
Remove-Item temp:/$PID; Pop-Location
```

# Expected behavior

The test should succeed: since the directory is empty, no commands of any kind should be found.

# Actual behavior

The test fails, because all commands discovered via `$env:PATH` are included:

```none
Expected $null or empty, but got @(2to3, 2to3-, 2to3-2.7, 2to3-3.7, a2p, a2p5.18, aapt, ab, ac, accton).
```

(The file names are utilities that happen to be available on macOS.)

# Environment data

```none
PowerShell Core 7.1.0-preview.2
```
title: Get-Command with a wildcard path includes PATH-based applications with -CommandType Application
